CVE-2014-0651.title: Cisco Context Directory Agent Lets Remote Authenticated Users Take Administrative Actions
CVE-2014-0651.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Context Directory Agent. A remote authenticated user can perform administrative actions on the target system.A remote authenticated user can access an active session to perform administrative actions on the target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj45347 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0651.extra: A remote authenticated user can perform administrative actions on the target system.

CVE-2014-0652.title: Cisco Context Directory Agent Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0652.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Context Directory Agent. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Context Directory Agent software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj45358 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0652.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Context Directory Agent software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0653.title: Cisco ASA Identity Firewall NetBIOS Logout Probe Response Handling Bug Lets Remote Users Modify Access Status
CVE-2014-0653.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can affect the integrity of a target user's access.The system does not properly validate NetBIOS probe responses. A remote user can send a specially crafted NetBIOS probe response to exploit a flaw in the Identity Firewall feature and impact the authorization status of users authorized via the Identity Firewall feature.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj45340 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0653.extra: A remote user can affect the integrity of a target user's access.

CVE-2014-0654.title: Cisco Context Directory Agent Message Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify the Cache
CVE-2014-0654.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Context Directory Agent. A remote user can modify the cache.A remote user can replay RADIUS accounting messages to modify the contents of the Context Directory Agent (CDA) cache.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj45383 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0654.extra: A remote user can modify the cache.

CVE-2014-0655.title: Cisco ASA RADIUS Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify the Identity Firewall Cache
CVE-2014-0655.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can modify the Identity Firewall cache.A remote user can replay RADIUS Change of Authorization (CoA) messages to modify the contents of the Identity Firewall (IDFW) user cache.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj45332 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0655.extra: A remote user can modify the Identity Firewall user cache.

CVE-2014-0656.title: Cisco Context Directory Agent Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Modify Input Data
CVE-2014-0656.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Context Directory Agent. A remote authenticated user can modify input data fields.A remote authenticated user can hide values in certain input fields on the Context Directory Agent (CDA) user interface.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj45353 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0656.extra: A remote authenticated user can modify input data fields.

CVE-2014-0657.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Role Access Controls
CVE-2014-0657.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can bypass role access controls.A remote authenticated user can reload the link to a previously denied location on the administration portal to gain access to portions of the portal for which the user does not have role-based access privileges.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj83540 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0657.extra: A remote authenticated user can bypass role access controls.

CVE-2014-0658.title: Cisco 9900 Series IP Phones SIP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Unregister Phones
CVE-2014-0658.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 9900 Series IP Phones. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted SIP header data to cause the target IP phone to unregister.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul24898 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0658.extra: A remote user can cause the target phone to unregister.

CVE-2014-0659.title: Cisco Gigabit Security Router Undocumented Test Interface Lets Remote Users Gain Root Access
CVE-2014-0659.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco WRVS4400N and RVS4000 Gigabit Security Routers. A remote user can gain root access on the target device.A remote user on the local area network can access an undocumented test interface on TCP port 32764 to execute arbitrary operating system commands with root privileges. This can also be exploited to access the administrator account credentials.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCum43693 and CSCum43700 (for the WRVS4400N Wireless-N Gigabit Security Router) and CSCum43685 (for the Cisco RVS4000 4-port Gigabit Security Router).The original advisory is available at:https://github.com/elvanderb/TCP-32764Eloi Vanderbeken reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0659.extra: A remote user on the local network can gain root access on the target device.

CVE-2014-0659.title: Cisco Access Points Undocumented Test Interface Lets Remote Users Gain Root Access
CVE-2014-0659.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco WAP4410N Access Point. A remote user can gain root access on the target device.A remote user on the local area network can access an undocumented test interface on TCP port 32764 to execute arbitrary operating system commands with root privileges. This can also be exploited to access the administrator account credentials.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum37566 to this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:https://github.com/elvanderb/TCP-32764Eloi Vanderbeken reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0659.extra: A remote user can gain root access on the target device.

CVE-2014-0660.title: Cisco TelePresence ISDN Gateway Q.931 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-0660.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco TelePresence ISDN Gateway. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted ISDN Q.931 STATUS message to cause the target D-channel to drop, terminating existing calls and preventing new calls.A software reload is required to return the system to normal operations.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui50360 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0660.extra: A remote user can cause existing calls to drop and prevent new calls from being established.

CVE-2014-0661.title: Cisco TelePresence System Software Input Validation Flaw in SSCD Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2014-0661.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco TelePresence System Software. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted XML-RPC data to trigger a stack corruption flaw in the System Status Collection Daemon (SSCD) and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui32796 to this vulnerability.The following hardware products are affected:Cisco TelePresence System 500-32Cisco TelePresence System 500-37Cisco TelePresence System 1000Cisco TelePresence System 1100Cisco TelePresence System 1300-65Cisco TelePresence System 3000Cisco TelePresence System 3010Cisco TelePresence System 3200Cisco TelePresence System 3210Cisco TelePresence System TX1300 47 (Also Known As the TX1300-47) Cisco TelePresence System TX1310 65Cisco TelePresence System TX9000Cisco TelePresence System TX9200
CVE-2014-0661.extra: A remote user on the adjacent network can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

CVE-2014-0662.title: Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) SIP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-0662.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Session Description Protocol (SDP) message via UDP/TCP port 5060 or TCP port 5061 to cause certain processes to fail, terminating active calls and preventing new calls from being established.A reload is required to return the system to normal operations.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue97632 to this vulnerability.Cisco TelePresence VCS Control, Cisco TelePresence VCS Expressway, and Cisco TelePresence VCS Starter Pack Expressway are affected.
CVE-2014-0662.extra: A remote user can cause active calls to be terminated and new calls from being established.

CVE-2014-0663.title: Cisco Secure Access Control Server Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0663.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Secure Access Control Server interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum03625 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0663.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Secure Access Control Server interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0664.title: Cisco Unity Connection IMAP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-0664.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unity Connection. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted IMAP commands to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul49976 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0664.extra: A remote authenticated user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.

CVE-2014-0665.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine RBAC Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Support Bundle Information
CVE-2014-0665.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can access support bundle information.A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the role-based access control code to access support bundle information, which may include potentially sensitive information such as the user database.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul83904 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0665.extra: A remote authenticated user can access support bundle information.

CVE-2014-0666.title: Cisco Jabber for Windows Bug in Send Screen Capture Feature Lets Remote Users Install Arbitrary Files
CVE-2014-0666.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Jabber for Windows. A remote user can install arbitrary files on the target user's system.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Send Screen Capture function to install arbitrary files on the target user's system.This can be exploited to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug48056 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0666.extra: A remote user can install arbitrary files on the target user's system.

CVE-2014-0667.title: Cisco Secure Access Control Server RMI Interface Lets Remote Users Read Files
CVE-2014-0667.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control Server. A remote user can read files on the target system.A remote user can supply a specially crafted request via the RMI interface to read arbitrary files on target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud75169 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0667.extra: A remote user can read arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2014-0668.title: Cisco Secure Access Control Server Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0668.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Secure Access Control Server Portal and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue65949 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0668.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Secure Access Control Server Portal, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0669.title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Gateway WSP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Network Access Controls
CVE-2014-0669.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Gateway. A remote user can bypass access controls and browse the network free of charge.A remote user can send specially crafted Wireless Session Protocol (WSP) packets to the target Cisco ASR 5000 Series Gateway GPRS Support Node (GGSN) to browse free of charge instead of being redirected to a Top-Up portal.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh28371 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0669.extra: A remote user can browse the network free of charge.

CVE-2014-0670.title: Cisco MediaSense Input Validation Flaw in Search and Play Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0670.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco MediaSense. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Search and Play interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco MediaSense software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum16686 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0670.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco MediaSense software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0671.title: Cisco MediaSense Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct URL Redirection Attacks
CVE-2014-0671.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco MediaSense. A remote user can conduct URL redirection attacks.The system does not properly validate a specific URL parameter. A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum16749 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0671.extra: A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL.

CVE-2014-0672.title: Cisco MediaSense Bug in Search and Play Interface Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Recordings
CVE-2014-0672.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco MediaSense. A remote authenticated user can access recordings on the target system.A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the Search and Play interface to access recordings.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum16755 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0672.extra: A remote authenticated user can access recordings on the target system.

CVE-2014-0673.title: Cisco Video Surveillance Camera Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0673.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Video Surveillance 5000 Series HD IP Dome Camera. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web user interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Video Surveillance Camera web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCud10943 and CSCud10950 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0673.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Video Surveillance Camera interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0674.title: Cisco Video Surveillance Software Operations Manager Lets Remote Users Access the MySQL Database
CVE-2014-0674.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Video Surveillance Operations Manager. A remote user can access the target database.A remote user can exploit a MySQL database configuration flaw to access the MySQL database on the target Cisco Video Surveillance Operations Manager (VSOM).The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud10992 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0674.extra: A remote user can access the target database.

CVE-2014-0676.title: Cisco NX-OS Lets Local Users Bypass TACACS+ Authorization to Execute Commands
CVE-2014-0676.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can execute a specially crafted sequence of multiple commands to exploit a TACACS+ command authorization bug and execute commands without proper authorization.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum47367 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0676.extra: A local user can bypass TACACS+ authorization to execute commands.

CVE-2014-0677.title: Cisco NX-OS Label Distribution Protocol Message Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-0677.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted Label Distribution Protocol (LDP) Hello messages to cause the target device to stop accepting valid LDP sessions for a 60-second period.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul88851 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0677.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to stop accepting valid LDP sessions for a 60-second period.

CVE-2014-0678.title: Cisco Secure Access Control System Portal Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-0678.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control Server. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote authenticated user can exploit a session management flaw to hijack the session of a previously authenticated user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue65951 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0678.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2014-0680.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in NAC Web Agent Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0680.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The HTTP control interface for NAC Web Agent does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the control interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui15038 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0680.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the control interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0681.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Report Output Pages Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0681.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The report output pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui15064 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0681.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0682.title: Cisco WebEx Meetings Server Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-0682.body: A vulnerability was reported in WebEx Meetings Server. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted URL to join meetings they are not authorized to attend or to end meetings for which they are not the host.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj42346 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0682.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.

CVE-2014-0723.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in IPMA Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0723.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Cisco IP Manager Assistant (IPMA) interface not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the IPMA interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum05343 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0723.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the IPMA interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0735.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in IPMA Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0735.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Cisco IP Manager Assistant (IPMA) interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the IPMA interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum46470 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0735.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the IPMA interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0736.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2014-0736.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.The Call Detail Records (CDR) Analysis and Reporting (CAR) page does not properly validate user-supplied requests. A remote user can take actions on the CAR web interface acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum46468 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0736.extra: A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0740.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Bugs Let Remote Users Modify System Data and Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks and Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-0740.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can modify system information. A local user can read and write files on the target system. A local user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will take actions on the OS Administration Call Detail Records (CDR) Analysis and Reporting (CAR) web interface acting as the target user [CVE-2014-0740].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun00701 to this vulnerability.A local user can submit a specially crafted command line entry to exploit a flaw in the certificate import Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) command-line function to read or write arbitrary files to the underlying operating system [CVE-2014-0741].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95461 to this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in the Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) command-line function for Certificate Signing Request (CSR) management to read or write arbitrary files to the underlying operating system [CVE-2014-0742].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95464 to this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) to modify information related to registered devices [CVE-2014-0743].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95468 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0740.extra: A remote user can take actions on the interface acting as the target user.A remote user can modify information related to registered devices.A local user can read and write files on the target system.A local user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.

CVE-2014-0743.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can modify system information. CVE-2014-0745.title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information and Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2014-0745.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Extress. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote authenticated user can access the CCMConfig page to access potentially sensitive information [CVE-2014-2102].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95575 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the disaster recovery system (DRS) to obtain potentially sensitive information about DRS-related devices [CVE-2014-0746].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95536 to this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will take actions on the Cisco Unified Serviceability interface acting as the target user [CVE-2014-0745].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95502 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0745.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0746.title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information and Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2014-0746.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Extress. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote authenticated user can access the CCMConfig page to access potentially sensitive information [CVE-2014-2102].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95575 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the disaster recovery system (DRS) to obtain potentially sensitive information about DRS-related devices [CVE-2014-0746].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95536 to this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will take actions on the Cisco Unified Serviceability interface acting as the target user [CVE-2014-0745].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95502 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0746.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0747.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Bugs Let Remote Users Modify System Data and Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks and Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-0747.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can modify system information. A local user can read and write files on the target system. A local user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will take actions on the OS Administration Call Detail Records (CDR) Analysis and Reporting (CAR) web interface acting as the target user [CVE-2014-0740].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun00701 to this vulnerability.A local user can submit a specially crafted command line entry to exploit a flaw in the certificate import Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) command-line function to read or write arbitrary files to the underlying operating system [CVE-2014-0741].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95461 to this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in the Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) command-line function for Certificate Signing Request (CSR) management to read or write arbitrary files to the underlying operating system [CVE-2014-0742].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95464 to this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) to modify information related to registered devices [CVE-2014-0743].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95468 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0747.extra: A remote user can take actions on the interface acting as the target user.A remote user can modify information related to registered devices.A local user can read and write files on the target system.A local user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.

CVE-2014-0874.title: IBM FileNet Content Manager Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0874.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM FileNet Content Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM FileNet Content Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.IBM Content Foundation is also affected.
CVE-2014-0874.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM FileNet Content Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0913.title: IBM iNotes Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0913.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM iNotes. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can send a specially crafted email that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM iNotes software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Bart Leppens reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-0913.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM iNotes software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-0919.title: IBM DB2 Audit and Monitoring Facility Discloses Passwords to Remote Authenticated Users
CVE-2014-0919.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM DB2. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including passwords, on the target system.A remote authenticated user with certain DB2 privileges can exploit a flaw in the audit and monitoring feature to view a password in certain SQL statements. SQL statements that contain ENCRYPT/DECRYPT UDFs or federated DDL statements are affected.Systems with monitoring or audit enabled and using federated DDL (i.e., CREATE SERVER or CREATE/ALTER USER MAPPING) or the ENCRYPT/DECRYPT UDFs with a password parameter are affected.
CVE-2014-0919.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including passwords, on the target system.

CVE-2014-0943.title: IBM WebSphere Commerce 'id' Parameter Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-0943.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Commerce. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted 'id' parameter value to cause the target service to consume excessive resources and crash.
CVE-2014-0943.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2014-0953.title: IBM WebSphere Portal Multiple Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting, URL Redirection, and Information Disclosure Attacks
CVE-2014-0953.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in IBM WebSphere Portal. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct URL redirection attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2014-0953, CVE-2014-3102]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM WebSphere software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can view error codes to identify systems behind the firewall [CVE-2014-4746].A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to redirect to an arbitrary web site [CVE-2014-4760].
CVE-2014-0953.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM WebSphere Portal software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to redirect to an arbitrary URL.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information about systems behind the firewall.

CVE-2014-0963.title: IBM Security Network Protection SSL Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-0963.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Security Network Protection. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted SSL messages to cause a single thread to enter a loop and consume excessive CPU resources in certain cases. This may cause the target device to become unresponsive.
CVE-2014-0963.extra: A remote user can cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system, which may cause the system to become unresponsive.

CVE-2014-0964.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Heartbeat Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-0964.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Application Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted TLS heartbeat messages to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.This can be triggered remotely by a Heatbleed scanning tool.
CVE-2014-0964.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2014-0977.title: Movable Type Input Validation Flaw in Editor Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-0977.body: A vulnerability was reported in Movable Type. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The rich text editor does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Movable Type software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2014-0977.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Movable Type software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-10022.title: Apache Traffic Server HttpTransact Boundary Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-10022.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache Traffic Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP TRACE request with a 'Max-Forwards' header value of '0' to cause the target service to crash and restart.
CVE-2014-10022.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash and restart.

CVE-2014-1204.title: Tableau Server Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2014-1204.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tableau Server. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user or a remote guest user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database. This can be exploited to take full control of an instance of Tableau Server.The vendor was notified on December 6, 2013.The original advisory is available at:https://www.trustwave.com/spiderlabs/advisories/TWSL2014-003.txtTanya Secker and Christiaan Esterhuizen of Trustwave SpiderLabs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1204.extra: A remote authenticated user or remote guest user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2014-1211.title: VMware vCloud Director Session Management Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2014-1211.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware vCloud Director. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can take actions on the management interface acting as the target user.Mattia Folador reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1211.extra: A remote user can take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-1213.title: Sophos Anti-Virus ACL Error Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-1213.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sophos Anti-Virus. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can modify certain system objects to cause the target system to eventually crash.The vendor was notified on November 11, 2013.The original advisory is available at:http://www.portcullis-security.com/security-research-and-downloads/security-advisories/cve-2014-1213/Graham Sutherland of Portcullis Computer Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1213.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2014-1242.title: Apple iTunes Tutorials Non-Secure Connection Lets Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
CVE-2014-1242.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple iTunes. A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.The iTunes Tutorials window uses a non-secure HTTP connection to retrieve content. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to inject arbitrary contents into the target user's iTunes Tutorials window.
CVE-2014-1242.extra: A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.

CVE-2014-1317.title: Apple OS X Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-1317.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The system may write the Apple ID credentials to the iBooks log file. A local user can obtain the credentials [CVE-2014-1317]. OS X 10.9.x is affected. Steve Dunham reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted zip file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an out-of-bounds byte swapping flaw in the processing of AppleDouble files and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-1370]. Chaitanya (SegFault) (via iDefense VCP) reported this vulnerability.A local application can trigger an invalid pointer dereference to bypass sandbox restrictions and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-1371]. An anonymous researcher (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.A local user can trigger an out-of-bounds read flaw in the processing of system calls to read kernel memory and bypass kernel address space layout randomization (ASLR) security capabilities [CVE-2014-1372]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local application can trigger a validation flaw in the processing of an OpenGL API call to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1373]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in IOKit to read a kernel pointer and bypass ASLR security capabilities [CVE-2014-1375].A local application can trigger a bounds validation flaw in the processing of an OpenCL API call and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1376]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local application can trigger an array indexing flaw in IOAcceleratorFamily to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1377]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in IOKit to read a kernel pointer and bypass ASLR security capabilities [CVE-2014-1378]. OS X 10.9.x is affected.A local application can trigger a null dereference to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1379]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can bypass the screen lock to type into windows under the screen lock [CVE-2014-1380]. OS X 10.9.x is affected. Ben Langfeld of Mojo Lingo LLC reported this vulnerability.A local user can trigger an out of bounds memory access flaw in the processing of IOThunderBoltController API calls to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1381]. OS X 10.9.x is affected. Catherine aka winocm reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1317.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2014-1325.title: Apple Safari Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Spoof URLs
CVE-2014-1325.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can spoof URLs.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-1325, CVE-2014-1340, CVE-2014-1362, CVE-2014-1363, CVE-2014-1364, CVE-2014-1365, CVE-2014-1366, CVE-2014-1367, CVE-2014-1368, CVE-2014-1382]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Apple, miaubiz, Google Chrome Security Team, Wushi of Keen Team (Research Team of Keen Cloud Tech), and Renata Hodovan of University of Szeged / Samsung Electronics reported these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when dragged by the target user to another window, will obtain the contents of files on the target user's system [CVE-2014-1369]. Aaron Sigel of vtty.com reported this vulnerability.A remote website can spoof its domain name in the address bar [CVE-2014-1345]. Erling Ellingsen of Facebook reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1325.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain file contents from the target user's system.A remote user can spoof domain names in the address bar.

CVE-2014-1340.title: Apple Safari Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Spoof URLs
CVE-2014-1340.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can spoof URLs.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-1325, CVE-2014-1340, CVE-2014-1362, CVE-2014-1363, CVE-2014-1364, CVE-2014-1365, CVE-2014-1366, CVE-2014-1367, CVE-2014-1368, CVE-2014-1382]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Apple, miaubiz, Google Chrome Security Team, Wushi of Keen Team (Research Team of Keen Cloud Tech), and Renata Hodovan of University of Szeged / Samsung Electronics reported these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when dragged by the target user to another window, will obtain the contents of files on the target user's system [CVE-2014-1369]. Aaron Sigel of vtty.com reported this vulnerability.A remote website can spoof its domain name in the address bar [CVE-2014-1345]. Erling Ellingsen of Facebook reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1340.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain file contents from the target user's system.A remote user can spoof domain names in the address bar.

CVE-2014-1348.title: Apple iOS Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Let Local Applications Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-1348.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple iOS. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local application can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The system does not properly encrypt mail attachments. A physically local user can read mail attachments [CVE-2014-1348]. Andreas Kurtz of NESO Security Labs reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a use-after-free in Safari and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-1349]. Reno Robert and Dhanesh Kizhakkinan reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can disable the 'Find My iPhone' feature [CVE-2014-1350].A physically local user can invoke Siri to bypass the passcode requirement and display a list of contacts [CVE-2014-1351]. Sherif Hashim reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can exceed the maximum number of failed passcode attempts [CVE-2014-1352]. mblsec reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can exploit an Airplane Mode state management flaw to access the application that was in the foreground prior to the screen locking [CVE-2014-1353].A remote user can create a specially crafted XBM file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack allocation error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-1354]. Dima Kovalenko of codedigging.com reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger a null pointer dereference in the processing of IOKit API arguments and cause the device to restart [CVE-2014-1355]. cunzhang from Adlab of Venustech reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger a heap overflow in launchd in the processing of IPC messages and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1356]. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger a heap overflow in launchd in the processing of log messages and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1357]. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an integer overflow in launchd and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1358]. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an integer underflow in launchd and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1359]. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can bypass Activation Lock [CVE-2014-1360].A remote user can send a specially crafted DTLS message to trigger a memory initialization flaw and obtain two bytes of memory contents [CVE-2014-1361]. Thijs Alkemade of The Adium Project reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1348.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local application can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A physically local user can access mail attachments.A physically local user can bypass Activation Lock and Screen Lock.A physically local user can disable the 'Find My iPhone' feature.

CVE-2014-1362.title: Apple Safari Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Spoof URLs
CVE-2014-1362.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can spoof URLs.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-1325, CVE-2014-1340, CVE-2014-1362, CVE-2014-1363, CVE-2014-1364, CVE-2014-1365, CVE-2014-1366, CVE-2014-1367, CVE-2014-1368, CVE-2014-1382]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Apple, miaubiz, Google Chrome Security Team, Wushi of Keen Team (Research Team of Keen Cloud Tech), and Renata Hodovan of University of Szeged / Samsung Electronics reported these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when dragged by the target user to another window, will obtain the contents of files on the target user's system [CVE-2014-1369]. Aaron Sigel of vtty.com reported this vulnerability.A remote website can spoof its domain name in the address bar [CVE-2014-1345]. Erling Ellingsen of Facebook reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1362.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain file contents from the target user's system.A remote user can spoof domain names in the address bar.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Apple, miaubiz, Google Chrome Security Team, Wushi of Keen Team (Research Team of Keen Cloud Tech), and Renata Hodovan of University of Szeged / Samsung Electronics reported these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when dragged by the target user to another window, will obtain the contents of files on the target user's system [CVE-2014-1369]. Aaron Sigel of vtty.com reported this vulnerability.A remote website can spoof its domain name in the address bar [CVE-2014-1345]. Erling Ellingsen of Facebook reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1367.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain file contents from the target user's system.A remote user can spoof domain names in the address bar.

CVE-2014-1370.title: Apple OS X Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-1370.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The system may write the Apple ID credentials to the iBooks log file. A local user can obtain the credentials [CVE-2014-1317]. OS X 10.9.x is affected. Steve Dunham reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted zip file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an out-of-bounds byte swapping flaw in the processing of AppleDouble files and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-1370]. Chaitanya (SegFault) (via iDefense VCP) reported this vulnerability.A local application can trigger an invalid pointer dereference to bypass sandbox restrictions and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-1371]. An anonymous researcher (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.A local user can trigger an out-of-bounds read flaw in the processing of system calls to read kernel memory and bypass kernel address space layout randomization (ASLR) security capabilities [CVE-2014-1372]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local application can trigger a validation flaw in the processing of an OpenGL API call to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1373]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in IOKit to read a kernel pointer and bypass ASLR security capabilities [CVE-2014-1375].A local application can trigger a bounds validation flaw in the processing of an OpenCL API call and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1376]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local application can trigger an array indexing flaw in IOAcceleratorFamily to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1377]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in IOKit to read a kernel pointer and bypass ASLR security capabilities [CVE-2014-1378]. OS X 10.9.x is affected.A local application can trigger a null dereference to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1379]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can bypass the screen lock to type into windows under the screen lock [CVE-2014-1380]. OS X 10.9.x is affected. Ben Langfeld of Mojo Lingo LLC reported this vulnerability.A local user can trigger an out of bounds memory access flaw in the processing of IOThunderBoltController API calls to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1381]. OS X 10.9.x is affected. Catherine aka winocm reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1370.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in IOKit to read a kernel pointer and bypass ASLR security capabilities [CVE-2014-1375].A local application can trigger a bounds validation flaw in the processing of an OpenCL API call and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1376]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local application can trigger an array indexing flaw in IOAcceleratorFamily to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1377]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in IOKit to read a kernel pointer and bypass ASLR security capabilities [CVE-2014-1378]. OS X 10.9.x is affected.A local application can trigger a null dereference to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1379]. OS X 10.8.x and 10.9.x are affected. Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can bypass the screen lock to type into windows under the screen lock [CVE-2014-1380]. OS X 10.9.x is affected. Ben Langfeld of Mojo Lingo LLC reported this vulnerability.A local user can trigger an out of bounds memory access flaw in the processing of IOThunderBoltController API calls to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2014-1381]. OS X 10.9.x is affected. Catherine aka winocm reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1381.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2014-1382.title: Apple Safari Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Spoof URLs
CVE-2014-1382.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can spoof URLs.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-1325, CVE-2014-1340, CVE-2014-1362, CVE-2014-1363, CVE-2014-1364, CVE-2014-1365, CVE-2014-1366, CVE-2014-1367, CVE-2014-1368, CVE-2014-1382]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Apple, miaubiz, Google Chrome Security Team, Wushi of Keen Team (Research Team of Keen Cloud Tech), and Renata Hodovan of University of Szeged / Samsung Electronics reported these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when dragged by the target user to another window, will obtain the contents of files on the target user's system [CVE-2014-1369]. Aaron Sigel of vtty.com reported this vulnerability.A remote website can spoof its domain name in the address bar [CVE-2014-1345]. Erling Ellingsen of Facebook reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-1382.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain file contents from the target user's system.A remote user can spoof domain names in the address bar.

CVE-2014-1383.title: Apple TV Bug Lets Local Users Bypass the Purchase Authorization Password Requirement
CVE-2014-1383.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple TV. A local user can make purchases without authorization.A local user signed in to Apple TV can conduct an iTunes Store transaction without supplying a valid password.
CVE-2014-1383.extra: A local user can make purchases without authorization.

CVE-2014-1384.title: Apple Safari WebKit Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2014-1384.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Apple, an anonymous researcher, and the Google Chrome Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2014-1384.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
