CVE-2014-7988.title: Cisco Unity Connection Discloses Potentially Sensitive Information to Remote Authenticated Users
CVE-2014-7988.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unity Connection. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the Unified Messaging Service (UMS) to access potentially sensitive information from the logs.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur06493 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-7988.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2014-7989.title: Cisco Unified Computing System ping6 and traceroute6 Command Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-7989.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System (Managed). A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can issue a specially crafted ping6 or traceroute6 command-line interface command to gain shell access on the target system.Cisco Unified Computing System B-Series Blade Servers are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq38176 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-7989.extra: A local user can obtain shell access on the target system.

CVE-2014-7990.title: Cisco IOS XE Flaw in 'request system shell' Command Lets Local Administrative Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-7990.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user with administrative privilege (15) can provide a specially crafted crafted challenge response to exploit a flaw in the 'request system shell' command and gain access to the operating system shell.Systems with the 'service internal' command configured are affected.The WS-C3850, WS-C3860, and AIR-CT5760 platforms are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur09815 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-7990.extra: A local administrative user can gain access to the operating system shell.

CVE-2014-7991.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Remote Mobile Access Subsystem Certificate Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Spoof the System
CVE-2014-7991.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can spoof the system.A remote user can supply a Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate containing a specially crafted Subject Alternative Name (SAN) field that is signed by a certificate authority trusted by the Cisco Unified Communications Manager (Unified CM) to exploit a flaw in the Remote Mobile Access Subsystem and impersonate a valid Video Communication Server (VCS) device.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq86376 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-7991.extra: A remote user can spoof the system and masquerade as a valid Video Communication Server (VCS) device.

CVE-2014-7992.title: Cisco IOS DLSw Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2014-7992.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.The system does not properly initialize packet buffers. A remote user can connect to the DLSw port (TCP port 2067) to obtain potentially sensitive information from previously processed packets. This may include clear-text passwords and SNMP community strings.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur14014 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-7992.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2014-7997.title: Cisco Aironet DHCP Lease Renewal Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-7997.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user on the adjacent network can prevent the target access point from renewing its DHCP lease to cause the target device to restart.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtn16281 to this vulnerability.Maxim Salomon and Timo Warns of Airbus Operations GmbH reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-7997.extra: A remote user on the local network can cause the target device to restart.

CVE-2014-7998.title: Cisco Aironet EAP Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-7998.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted EAP packet when the 'debug dot11 aaa authenticator all' command is enabled on the device to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul15509 to this vulnerability.Maxim Salomon and Timo Warns of Airbus Operations GmbH reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-7998.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2014-8000.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service Discloses Valid Usernames to Remote Users
CVE-2014-8000.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service. A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted URL requests to the target device to determine if a specified username account exists on the target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur63497 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8000.extra: A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.

CVE-2014-8004.title: Cisco IOS XR LISP TCP Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-8004.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send multiple specially crafted Locator/ID Separation Protocol (LISP) TCP sessions to cause the target LISP service to reload.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq90378 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8004.extra: A remote user can cause the target LISP process to reload.

CVE-2014-8007.title: Cisco Prime Infrastructure Quick Discovery Page Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Passwords
CVE-2014-8007.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Infrastructure. A remote authenticated user can view passwords on the target system.A remote authenticated user can access the Quick Discovery options page to view the passwords stored for device discovery.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum00019 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8007.extra: A remote authenticated user can view passwords on the target system.

CVE-2014-8008.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Bug in Real-Time Monitoring Tool API Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Files
CVE-2014-8008.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can obtain files from the target system.A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted absolute path to a Real-Time Monitoring Tool (RTMT) API command to obtain arbitrary files from the target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur49414 to this vulnerability.Vantage Point reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8008.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain arbitrary files from the target system.

CVE-2014-8010.title: Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-8010.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote authenticated administrative user can send specially crafted data to cause commands to be executed on the underlying operating system. The commands will run with the privileges of the target web service.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq50205 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8010.extra: A remote authenticated administrative user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2014-8012.title: Cisco ASA Input Validation in WebVPN Portal Login Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-8012.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Portal Login page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in cookie values before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco ASA interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Devices configured for WebVPN are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh24695 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8012.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco ASA interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8013.title: Cisco NX-OS TACACS+ Command Processing Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-8013.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can submit a specially crafted command that requires command authorization to exploit a flaw in the TACACS+ command authorization cause the system to reset.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur54182 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8013.extra: A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2014-8015.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Other User Accounts
CVE-2014-8015.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can access and modify account information.A remote authenticated user from one sponsor can exploit a flaw in the Sponsor Portal to gain access to guest accounts created from a different sponsor account. The user can modify the login and account details.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur64400 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8015.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain access to and modify guest accounts created under a different sponsor account.

CVE-2014-8017.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Unspecified Error Lets Remote Users Obtain the Backup Password
CVE-2014-8017.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can obtain the backup password.A remote user can send a specially crafted request to exploit a flaw in the periodic backup function and obtain the password used to encrypt the backup.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur41673 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8017.extra: A remote user can obtain the backup password.

CVE-2014-8018.title: Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager Input Validation Flaw in BVSM Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-8018.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Business Voice Services Manager (BVSM) pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCur19651, CSCur18555, CSCur19630, and CSCur19661 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8018.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8019.title: Cisco Enterprise Content Delivery System Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users View Arbitrary Files
CVE-2014-8019.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Enterprise Content Delivery System. A remote user can view arbitrary files on the target system.The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request containing directory traversal characters to view arbitrary files on target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo90148 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8019.extra: A remote user can view arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2014-8020.title: Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager TCP/UDP Rate Limiting Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-8020.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted TCP and UDP packets at a high rate to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system, adversely affecting system performance and service availability.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup25276 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8020.extra: A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system, adversely affecting system performance and service availability.

CVE-2014-8022.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Web Framework Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-8022.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web framework does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Identity Services Engine software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCur69835 and CSCur69776 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8022.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Identity Services Engine software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8023.title: Cisco ASA VPN Tunnel Group Selection Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Access Controls
CVE-2014-8023.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can bypass access controls to access VPN tunnel group resources.A remote authenticated user that authenticates to the target remote access VPN via the challenge-response mechanism can supply a specially crafted tunnel group parameter to gain access to a different tunnel group.LDAP, RADIUS, TACACS+, and RSA-based challenge-response authentication may also be affected.Systems configured for Clientless or AnyConnect SSL VPN are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtz48533 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8023.extra: A remote authenticated user can access a different VPN tunnel group's resources.

CVE-2014-8024.title: Cisco Jabber Guest Server Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Information Disclosure Attacks
CVE-2014-8024.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Jabber Guest Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can provide specially crafted parameter values to the application programming interface (API) to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2014-8024].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus19789 to this vulnerability.A remote user can provide specially crafted parameter values to the application programming interface (API) to obtain potentially sensitive system information [CVE-2014-8025].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus19801 to this vulnerability.The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2014-8026]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Jabber Guest Server interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus08074 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8024.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Jabber Guest Server interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2014-8027.title: Cisco Secure Access Control Server Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-8027.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control Server. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted HTTP requests to perform Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations on any Network Identity Group with the privileges of a Network Device Administrator.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq79034 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8027.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2014-8028.title: Cisco Secure Access Control Server Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-8028.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Secure Access Control Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq79019 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8028.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the web interface of the Cisco Secure Access Control Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8030.title: Cisco WebEx Meetings Server Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass Authentication, Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks, and Obtain Encrypted Passwords
CVE-2014-8030.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx Meetings Server. A remote user can bypass authentication. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote authenticated user can obtain encrypted passwords.The 'sendPwMail.do' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2014-8030]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco WebEx Meetings Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj40381 to this vulnerability.A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the interface acting as the target user [CVE-2014-8031].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj40456 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the OutlookAction class to "generate sensitive encrypted values" [CVE-2014-8032].The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuj40453 and CSCuj40449 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted URL requests to an exposed API to gain administrator access [CVE-2014-8033].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj40421 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8030.extra: A remote user can bypass authentication and gain administrative access.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco WebEx Meetings Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote authenticated user can obtain encrypted passwords.

CVE-2014-8116.title: FreeBSD file(1) and libmagic(3) File Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-8116.body: A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can trigger several flaws in the ELF parser to cause the libmagic(3) library (used by the file(1) utility) to consume excessive resources or crash.Thomas Jarosch of Intra2net AG reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2014-8116.extra: A local user can cause the target system to consume excessive resources or crash.

CVE-2014-8117.title: FreeBSD file(1) and libmagic(3) File Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-8117.body: A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can trigger several flaws in the ELF parser to cause the libmagic(3) library (used by the file(1) utility) to consume excessive resources or crash.Thomas Jarosch of Intra2net AG reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2014-8117.extra: A local user can cause the target system to consume excessive resources or crash.

CVE-2014-8127.title: Apple OS X Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-8127.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can bypass security restrictions.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by libtiff, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-8127, CVE-2014-8128, CVE-2014-8129, CVE-2014-8130].A local user (process) can exploit a flaw in the checking of XPC entitlements to gain administrative privileges [CVE-2015-3671]. OS X 10.9.5 and 10.10.x are affected.Emil Kvarnhammar at TrueSec reported this vulnerability.A local user without administrative privileges can trigger a flaw in user authentication to gain administrative privileges [CVE-2015-3672]. OS X 10.9.5 and 10.10.x are affected.Emil Kvarnhammar at TrueSec reported this vulnerability.A local user can move and modify Directory Utility to gain root privileges on the target system [CVE-2015-3673]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Patrick Wardle of Synack and Emil Kvarnhammar at TrueSec reported this vulnerability.A remote user can trigger a memory corruption flaw in the AFP server to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3674]. Dean Jerkovich of NCC Group reported this vulnerability.The default Apache configuration does not include mod_hfs_apple. A remote can submit a specially crafted URL to access ostensibly protected directories on the target web service [CVE-2015-3675]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.A local application can determine kernel memory layout [CVE-2015-3676, CVE-2015-3677, CVE-2015-3690, CVE-2015-3711, CVE-2015-3721].Chen Liang of KEEN Team, an anonymous researcher (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Peter Rutenbar (via with HP's Zero Day Initiative), and Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.A local user (application) can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code with system privileges. AppleThunderboltEDMService is affected [CVE-2015-3678]. Bluetooth HCI is affected [CVE-2015-3683]. The Monitor Control Command Set kernel extension is affected [CVE-2015-3691]. The 'Install.framework' 'runner' binary is affected [CVE-2015-3704]. IOAcceleratorFamily is affected [CVE-2015-3705, CVE-2015-3706]. The FireWire driver is affected [CVE-2015-3707]. The NVIDIA graphics driver is affected [CVE-2015-3712].Roberto Paleari and Aristide Fattori of Emaze Networks, Ian Beer of Google Project Zero, and KEEN Team reported some of these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2015-3679, CVE-2015-3680, CVE-2015-3681, CVE-2015-3682]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Pawel Wylecial (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), John Villamil (@day6reak) of the Yahoo Pentest Team, and Nuode Wei reported these vulnerabilities.A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can use a certificate signed by an incorrecly issued CNNIC certificate authority to bypass trusted certificate validation.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3684].A remote user can create a specially crafted text file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3685, CVE-2015-3686, CVE-2015-3687, CVE-2015-3688, CVE-2015-3689].John Villamil (@day6reak) of the Yahoo Pentest Team reported some of these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3694]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.John Villamil (@day6reak) of the Yahoo Pentest Team reported this vulnerability.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the Intel graphics driver to execute arbitrary code system privileges [CVE-2015-3695, CVE-2015-3696, CVE-2015-3697, CVE-2015-3698, CVE-2015-3699, CVE-2015-3700, CVE-2015-3701, CVE-2015-3702].KEEN Team and Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported some of these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.tiff' file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3703].A local user (application) can exploit a symbolic link (symlink) flaw in kext tools to overwrite arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2015-3708]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a time-of-check time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition during the validation of kernel extension paths to load unsigned kernel extensions [CVE-2015-3709]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send a specially crafted email message that, when loaded by the target user, will replace the message content with an arbitrary web page [CVE-2015-3710]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Aaron Sigel of vtty.com and Jan Soucek reported this vulnerability.A local user (application) that uses custom resource rules can be modified so that the system will still launch the application [CVE-2015-3714].Joshua Pitts of Leviathan Security Group reported this vulnerability.A local user (application) can load a library outside of the application bundle to bypass code signing protection [CVE-2015-3715].Patrick Wardle of Synack reported this vulnerability.A local user can create a specially crafted photo file and add the file to the local photo library and then search Spotlight for the file to execute arbitrary commands on the target system [CVE-2015-3716].A remote user can trigger buffer overflows in SQLite to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3717]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Peter Rutenbar (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.A local user (application) can send a specially crafted interprocess communication message to trigger a type confusion flaw in 'systemstatsd' and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3718]. The code will run with the privileges of the target process. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Roberto Paleari and Aristide Fattori of Emaze Networks reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a memory corruption flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3719]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.John Villamil (@day6reak) of the Yahoo Pentest Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8127.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2014-8129.title: Apple OS X Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-8129.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can bypass security restrictions.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by libtiff, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-8127, CVE-2014-8128, CVE-2014-8129, CVE-2014-8130].A local user (process) can exploit a flaw in the checking of XPC entitlements to gain administrative privileges [CVE-2015-3671]. OS X 10.9.5 and 10.10.x are affected.Emil Kvarnhammar at TrueSec reported this vulnerability.A local user without administrative privileges can trigger a flaw in user authentication to gain administrative privileges [CVE-2015-3672]. OS X 10.9.5 and 10.10.x are affected.Emil Kvarnhammar at TrueSec reported this vulnerability.A local user can move and modify Directory Utility to gain root privileges on the target system [CVE-2015-3673]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Patrick Wardle of Synack and Emil Kvarnhammar at TrueSec reported this vulnerability.A remote user can trigger a memory corruption flaw in the AFP server to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3674]. Dean Jerkovich of NCC Group reported this vulnerability.The default Apache configuration does not include mod_hfs_apple. A remote can submit a specially crafted URL to access ostensibly protected directories on the target web service [CVE-2015-3675]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.A local application can determine kernel memory layout [CVE-2015-3676, CVE-2015-3677, CVE-2015-3690, CVE-2015-3711, CVE-2015-3721].Chen Liang of KEEN Team, an anonymous researcher (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Peter Rutenbar (via with HP's Zero Day Initiative), and Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.A local user (application) can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code with system privileges. AppleThunderboltEDMService is affected [CVE-2015-3678]. Bluetooth HCI is affected [CVE-2015-3683]. The Monitor Control Command Set kernel extension is affected [CVE-2015-3691]. The 'Install.framework' 'runner' binary is affected [CVE-2015-3704]. IOAcceleratorFamily is affected [CVE-2015-3705, CVE-2015-3706]. The FireWire driver is affected [CVE-2015-3707]. The NVIDIA graphics driver is affected [CVE-2015-3712].Roberto Paleari and Aristide Fattori of Emaze Networks, Ian Beer of Google Project Zero, and KEEN Team reported some of these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2015-3679, CVE-2015-3680, CVE-2015-3681, CVE-2015-3682]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Pawel Wylecial (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), John Villamil (@day6reak) of the Yahoo Pentest Team, and Nuode Wei reported these vulnerabilities.A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can use a certificate signed by an incorrecly issued CNNIC certificate authority to bypass trusted certificate validation.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3684].A remote user can create a specially crafted text file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3685, CVE-2015-3686, CVE-2015-3687, CVE-2015-3688, CVE-2015-3689].John Villamil (@day6reak) of the Yahoo Pentest Team reported some of these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3694]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.John Villamil (@day6reak) of the Yahoo Pentest Team reported this vulnerability.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the Intel graphics driver to execute arbitrary code system privileges [CVE-2015-3695, CVE-2015-3696, CVE-2015-3697, CVE-2015-3698, CVE-2015-3699, CVE-2015-3700, CVE-2015-3701, CVE-2015-3702].KEEN Team and Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported some of these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.tiff' file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3703].A local user (application) can exploit a symbolic link (symlink) flaw in kext tools to overwrite arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2015-3708]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a time-of-check time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition during the validation of kernel extension paths to load unsigned kernel extensions [CVE-2015-3709]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Ian Beer of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send a specially crafted email message that, when loaded by the target user, will replace the message content with an arbitrary web page [CVE-2015-3710]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Aaron Sigel of vtty.com and Jan Soucek reported this vulnerability.A local user (application) that uses custom resource rules can be modified so that the system will still launch the application [CVE-2015-3714].Joshua Pitts of Leviathan Security Group reported this vulnerability.A local user (application) can load a library outside of the application bundle to bypass code signing protection [CVE-2015-3715].Patrick Wardle of Synack reported this vulnerability.A local user can create a specially crafted photo file and add the file to the local photo library and then search Spotlight for the file to execute arbitrary commands on the target system [CVE-2015-3716].A remote user can trigger buffer overflows in SQLite to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3717]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Peter Rutenbar (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.A local user (application) can send a specially crafted interprocess communication message to trigger a type confusion flaw in 'systemstatsd' and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3718]. The code will run with the privileges of the target process. OS X 10.10.x is affected.Roberto Paleari and Aristide Fattori of Emaze Networks reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a memory corruption flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3719]. OS X 10.10.x is affected.John Villamil (@day6reak) of the Yahoo Pentest Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8129.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2014-8138.title: Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Hypervisor Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Gain Elevated Privileges, and Deny Service
CVE-2014-8138.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Hypervisor. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user on the guest system can cause denial of service conditions or gain elevated privileges on the host system. A local user can access the target system.A remote user can create a JPEG 2000 image file with a specially crafted ICC color profile that, when loaded by the target user via JasPer, will trigger a double-free memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-8137].Jose Duart of the Google Security Team (via oCERT) reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted JPEG 2000 image file that, when loaded by the target user via JasPer, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-8138].Jose Duart of the Google Security Team (via oCERT) reported this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user on a guest system can exploit a race condition to trigger a memory corruption flaw in the worker_update_monitors_config() function to cause the host QEMU-KVM process to crash or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-3247].Frediano Ziglio of Red Hat reported this vulnerability.The Virtualization Manager web admin interface does not properly time out a session when a virtual machine (VM) is selected in the VM grid view. A local user can potentially access an unattended web interface [CVE-2015-1841].Einav Cohen of Red Hat reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8138.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user on the guest system can cause denial of service conditions on the host system.A local user on the guest system can gain elevated privileges on the host system.A local user can access the target system.

CVE-2014-8139.title: UnZip Buffer Overflows in '-t' Command Line Option Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2014-8139.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in UnZip. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted zip file that, when processed by the target user with the '-t' command line option, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CRC32 processing code is affected [CVE-2014-8139].The test_compr_eb() function is affected [CVE-2014-8140].The getZip64Data() function is affected [CVE-2014-8141].The original advisory is available at:http://www.ocert.org/advisories/ocert-2014-011.htmlMichele Spagnuolo of Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8139.extra: A remote user can create a zip file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2014-8140.title: UnZip Buffer Overflows in '-t' Command Line Option Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2014-8140.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in UnZip. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted zip file that, when processed by the target user with the '-t' command line option, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CRC32 processing code is affected [CVE-2014-8139].The test_compr_eb() function is affected [CVE-2014-8140].The getZip64Data() function is affected [CVE-2014-8141].The original advisory is available at:http://www.ocert.org/advisories/ocert-2014-011.htmlMichele Spagnuolo of Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8140.extra: A remote user can create a zip file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2014-8141.title: UnZip Buffer Overflows in '-t' Command Line Option Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2014-8141.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in UnZip. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted zip file that, when processed by the target user with the '-t' command line option, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CRC32 processing code is affected [CVE-2014-8139].The test_compr_eb() function is affected [CVE-2014-8140].The getZip64Data() function is affected [CVE-2014-8141].The original advisory is available at:http://www.ocert.org/advisories/ocert-2014-011.htmlMichele Spagnuolo of Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8141.extra: A remote user can create a zip file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2014-8143.title: Samba Active Directory Domain Controller Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-8143.body: A vulnerability was reported in Samba. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote authenticated user can set the LDB userAccountControl attribute UF_SERVER_TRUST_ACCOUNT bit to gain elevated privileges.Systems configured as an Active Directory Domain Controller (AD DC) are affected.Andrew Bartlett of Catalyst IT reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8143.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2014-8159.title: Linux Kernel Input Validation Flaw in Infiniband Lets Local Users Deny Service or Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-8159.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A local user can supply specially crafted parameters to the Infiniband User Verbs API to access arbitrary physical memory locations to cause the system to crash or to gain elevated privileges.Access to /dev/infiniband/uverbsX is required to exploit this flaw.
CVE-2014-8159.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2014-8176.title: OpenSSL Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2014-8176.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted application data to a connected DTLS peer between the ChangeCipherSpec and Finished messages to trigger an invalid memory free and cause a segmentation fault or memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-8176]. Versions 0.9.8 prior to 0.9.8za, 1.0.0 prior to 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 prior to 1.0.1h are affected.Praveen Kariyanahalli and Ivan Fratric and Felix Groebert of Google separately reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted ECParameters to cause the target service to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2015-1788]. Applications that process public keys, certificate requests, or certificates are affected. TLS clients and TLS servers with client authentication enabled are affected. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.Joseph Birr-Pixton reported this vulnerability on April 6, 2015.A remote user can create a specially crafted certificate or certificate revocation list (CRL) that, when processed by the target application, will trigger an out-of-bound memory read in X509_cmp_time() and cause a segmentation fault [CVE-2015-1789]. TLS clients that verify CRLs are affected. TLS clients and servers with client authentication enabled and that use custom verification callbacks may be affected.Robert Swiecki of Google reported this vulnerability on April 8, 2015 and Hanno Bock independently reported this vulnerability on April 11, 2015.A remote user can create specially crafted ASN.1-encoded PKCS#7 data with a missing EnvelopedContent component to trigger a null pointer dereference [CVE-2015-1790]. Applications that decrypt or parse PKCS#7 data from untrusted sources are affected. OpenSSL clients and servers are not affected. The impact was not specified.Michal Zalewski of Google reported this vulnerability on April 18, 2015.A remote user can create a specially crafted signedData message that specifies an unknown hash function OID to trigger an infinite loop in the CMS code [CVE-2015-1792]. Applications that verify signedData messages using the CMS code are affected.Johannes Bauer reported this vulnerability on March 31, 2015.
CVE-2014-8176.extra: A remote user can cause the target application to crash or enter an infinite loop.A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.The impact of one vulnerability was not disclosed.

CVE-2014-8246.title: CA Release Automation Multiple Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting, Cross-Site Request Forgery, and SQL Injection Attacks
CVE-2014-8246.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in CA Release Automation. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2014-8247]. The code will originate from the site running the CA Release Automation software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the target site [CVE-2014-8246].A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2014-8248].[Editor's note: CA Release Automation is formerly known as CA LISA Release Automation.]Lukasz Plonka and Julian Horoszkiewicz each reported two vulnerabilities (one jointly).
CVE-2014-8246.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the CA Release Automation software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2014-8247.title: CA Release Automation Multiple Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting, Cross-Site Request Forgery, and SQL Injection Attacks
CVE-2014-8247.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in CA Release Automation. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. CVE-2014-8248.title: CA Release Automation Multiple Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting, Cross-Site Request Forgery, and SQL Injection Attacks
CVE-2014-8248.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in CA Release Automation. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2014-8247]. The code will originate from the site running the CA Release Automation software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the target site [CVE-2014-8246].A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2014-8248].[Editor's note: CA Release Automation is formerly known as CA LISA Release Automation.]Lukasz Plonka and Julian Horoszkiewicz each reported two vulnerabilities (one jointly).
CVE-2014-8248.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the CA Release Automation software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2014-8275.title: HP Version Control Repository Manager Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2014-8275.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in HP Version Control Repository Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target interface acting as the target user [CVE-2015-5412].A remote user can gain unauthorized access, modify data, deny service, and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-5410].A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2015-5413].A remote user can send a specially crafted request to view potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2015-5411].A remote user can trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2015-5409].
CVE-2014-8275.extra: A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2014-8302.title: Splunk Input Validation Flaws Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-8302.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Splunk. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Splunk Web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The Event Parsing is affected. Versions 6.0.x and 6.1.x are affected.The Dashboard is affected.
CVE-2014-8302.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Splunk Web interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8303.title: Splunk Input Validation Flaws Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-8303.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Splunk. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Splunk Web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The Event Parsing is affected. Versions 6.0.x and 6.1.x are affected.The Dashboard is affected.
CVE-2014-8303.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Splunk Web interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8349.title: Liferay Enterprise Portal Enterprise Edition Input Validation Flaw in File Upload Comment Field Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-8349.body: A vulnerability was reported in Liferay Enterprise Portal Enterprise Edition. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Liferay Enterprise Portal software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The '_20_body' parameter in the comment field of an uploaded file is affected.The script execution will occur in the 'My Account', 'My Workflow Tasks', 'View' menu item of an authenticated administrator's account.Ariel Walter Garcia from Deloitte Argentina reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8349.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Liferay Enterprise Portal software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8370.title: VMware ESXi Arbitrary File Write Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-8370.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user on the guest operating system can write to arbitrary files to potentially gain elevated privileges on the guest system.A local user on the host operating system can write to arbitrary files to potentially gain elevated privileges on the host system.Systems with permissions added for a virtual machine administrator role, or higher role, to the target ESXi or a vCenter Server managing the target ESXi are affected.Shanon Olsson (via JPCERT) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8370.extra: A local user on the guest system can obtain elevated privileges on the target guest system.A local user on the host system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host system.

CVE-2014-8370.title: VMware Workstation/Player/Fusion Arbitrary File Write Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-8370.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware Workstation/Player/Fusion. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user on the guest operating system can write to arbitrary files to potentially gain elevated privileges on the guest system.A local user on the host operating system can write to arbitrary files to potentially gain elevated privileges on the host system.Shanon Olsson (via JPCERT) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8370.extra: A local user on the guest system can obtain elevated privileges on the target guest system.A local user on the host system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host system.

CVE-2014-8373.title: VMware vCloud Automation Center Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Administrative Privileges
CVE-2014-8373.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware vCloud Automation Center. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote authenticated vCloud Automation Center (vCAC) user can exploit a flaw in the VMware Remote Console (VMRC) to gain administrative access to the vCenter Server.Systems that use the "Connect (by) Using VMRC" function in vCAC to connect directly to vCenter Server are affected.
CVE-2014-8373.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain administrative access to the vCenter Server.

CVE-2014-8439.title: Adobe Flash Player Use-After-Free Memory Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2014-8439.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a use-after-free memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Sebastien Duquette of ESET, Timo Hirvonen of F-Secure, and Kafeine reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8439.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2014-8450.title: Adobe Acrobat/Reader Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, Gain Elevated Privileges, Execute Arbitrary Code, and Deny Service
CVE-2014-8450.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat/Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A buffer overflow vulnerability may occur [CVE-2015-5093].Heap buffer overflows may occur [CVE-2015-5096, CVE-2015-5098, CVE-2015-5105].Memory corruption errors may occur [CVE-2015-5087, CVE-2015-5094, CVE-2015-5100, CVE-2015-5102, CVE-2015-5103, CVE-2015-5104, CVE-2015-3095, CVE-2015-5115, CVE-2014-0566].A stack overflow may occur [CVE-2015-5110].Use-after-free memory errors may occur [CVE-2015-4448, CVE-2015-5095, CVE-2015-5099, CVE-2015-5101, CVE-2015-5111, CVE-2015-5113, CVE-2015-5114].Integer overflows may occur [CVE-2015-5097, CVE-2015-5108, CVE-2015-5109].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an information leak [CVE-2015-5107].Security bypass errors may occur to allow information disclosure [CVE-2015-4449, CVE-2015-4450, CVE-2015-5088, CVE-2015-5089, CVE-2015-5092, CVE-2014-8450].A remote user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. Validation bypass errors may occur to allow privilege escalation from low to medium integrity level [CVE-2015-4446, CVE-2015-5090, CVE-2015-5106].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a validation bypass flaw and cause denial of service conditions on the target system [CVE-2015-5091].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a null-pointer dereference and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-4443, CVE-2015-4444].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass restrictions on JavaScript API execution [CVE-2015-4435, CVE-2015-4438, CVE-2015-4441, CVE-2015-4445, CVE-2015-4447, CVE-2015-4451, CVE-2015-4452, CVE-2015-5085, CVE-2015-5086].AbdulAziz Hariri and Jasiel Spelman of HP Zero Day Initiative, Alex Infuhr of Cure53.de, bilou via VeriSign iDefense Labs, Brian Gorenc of HP Zero Day Initiative, Security Research Team at MWR Labs (@mwrlabs), James Forshaw of Google Project Zero, Jihui Lu of KeenTeam, JinCheng Liu of the Alibaba Security Research Team, Jun Xie of the Alibaba Security Research Team, Keen Team via HP's Zero Day Initiative, kernelsmith via HP's Zero Day Initiative, Mateusz Jurczyk of Google Project Zero, Matt Molinyawe of HP Zero Day Initiative, Mauro Gentile of Minded Security, Nicolas Joly via HP's Zero Day Initiative, Wei Lei and Wu Hongjun of Nanyang Technological University, and Wu Ha of the Alibaba Security Research Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2014-8450.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2014-8472.title: CA Cloud Service Management Bugs Let Remote Users Access Data, Deny Service, and Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2014-8472.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in CA Cloud Service Management. A remote user can gain access to data on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user with access to the target user's environment can conduct a replay attack with unspecified impact [CVE-2014-8471].A remote user can exploit a flaw in Identity Provider authentication token verification with unspecified impact [CVE-2014-8472].A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the target site acting as the target user [CVE-2014-8473].A remote user can supply XML data with a specially crafted XML external entity reference to access potentially sensitive information or cause denial of service conditions on the target site [CVE-2014-8474].Vladislav Mladenov, Julian Krautwald, Florian Feldmann, and Christian Mainka (@CheariX) of Horst Goertz Institute for IT-Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2014-8472.extra: A remote user can gain access to data on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can take actions on the target site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8473.title: CA Cloud Service Management Bugs Let Remote Users Access Data, Deny Service, and Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks

CVE-2014-8495.title: Citrix XenMobile MDX Toolkit Bug Fails to Encrypt Cached Application Data
CVE-2014-8495.body: A vulnerability was reported in Citrix XenMobile MDX Toolkit. A local user may be able to access certain application data.Wrapped applications may not encrypt cached application data.Wrapped applications running on iOS 8 are affected.Wrapped applications running on iOS 7.x are not affected.
CVE-2014-8495.extra: A local user may be able to access certain application data.

CVE-2014-8500.title: ISC BIND Resolver Resource Consumption Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-8500.body: A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send queries for domains that are in certain configurations (e.g., with difficult to resolve domain names) to consume excessive resources on the target system. This may cause the target 'named' service to crash.Recursive resolvers are affected.Authoritative servers may be affected if a remote user has control of a delegation traversed by the authoritative server in servicing the zone.Florian Maury of ANSSI reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8500.extra: A remote user can cause excessive resource consumption on the target system, which may cause the target 'named' service to crash.

CVE-2014-8580.title: Citrix NetScaler Application Delivery Controller and NetScaler Gateway Authentication Flaw Lets Remote Users Access Network Resources
CVE-2014-8580.body: A vulnerability was reported in Citrix NetScaler Application Delivery Controller and NetScaler Gateway. A remote user can gain access to the network resources of a different user.A remote user can exploit an authentication flaw to access the network resources of a different authenticated user.
CVE-2014-8580.extra: A remote user can gain access to the network resources of a different user.

CVE-2014-8601.title: PowerDNS Resolver Resource Consumption Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2014-8601.body: A vulnerability was reported in PowerDNS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send queries for domains that are in certain configurations (e.g., with difficult to resolve domain names) to cause degraded service on the target system.Only remote users listed as 'allow-from' clients can trigger the flaw.Florian Maury of ANSSI reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8601.extra: A remote user can cause performance degradation on the target service.

CVE-2014-8612.title: FreeBSD SCTP Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2014-8612.body: A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can supply a specially crafted SCTP stream ID value to read or write portions of kernel memory to obtain potentially sensitive information or gain elevated privileges.Clement Lecigne from Google Security Team and Francisco Falcon from Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8612.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2014-8616.title: Fortinet FortiADC Input Validation Flaws in SSLVPN Login Page, User Group Menu, VPN Template Menu, and Theme Login Page Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-8616.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Fortinet FortiADC. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Fortinet FortiADC interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The sslvpn login page [CVE-2015-1880], the user group menu [CVE-2014-8616], and the vpn template menus [CVE-2014-8616] are affected.The theme login page is affected in versions prior to 4.2 (D models) [CVE-2014-8618].Benjamin Kunz Mejri (Vulnerability Laboratory, Evolution Security GmbH), Jared Haight, and William Costa reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2014-8616.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Fortinet FortiADC interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8636.title: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks, and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2014-8636.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-8634, CVE-2014-8635].A remote user can create a specially crafted bitmap image that, when rendered by the target user's browser via a 'canvas' element, will access uninitialized memory [CVE-2014-8637].The navigator.sendBeacon() function does not honor the cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) specification. A remote user can exploit this to conduct cross-site request forgery attacks [CVE-2014-8638].A remote Web Proxy can return an HTTP 407 Proxy Authentication response with a specially crafted Set-Cookie header value to inject cookies and conduct session-fixation attacks [CVE-2014-8639].A remote user can create specially crafted Document Object Model (DOM) objects with specific properties that can bypass XrayWrappers to gain elevated privileges on the target user's system [CVE-2014-8636].A remote user can create specially crafted content that manipulates Web Audio to be able to access a small block of memory via an uninitialized pointer [CVE-2014-8640].A remote user can trigger a read-after-free memory error in the handling of tracks in WebRTC [CVE-2014-8641].Delegated Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) responder certificates do not recognize the id-pkix-ocsp-nocheck extension. A user may be able to connect to a web site that has a revoked certificate [CVE-2014-8642].A remote user that can exploit a separate flaw in the Gecko Media Plugin (GMP) can escape the sandbox on Windows-based systems [CVE-2014-8643].Christian Holler, Patrick McManus, Christoph Diehl, Gary Kwong, Jesse Ruderman, Byron Campen, Terrence Cole, Nils Ohlmeier, Muneaki Nishimura, Xiaofeng Zheng of the Blue Lotus Team at Tsinghua University, Google security researcher Michal Zalewski, Holger Fuhrmannek, Mitchell Harper, Nils, Brian Smith, and Mozilla developer Bobby Holley reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2014-8636.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can conduct session fixation attacks.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2014-8690.title: Exponent CMS Multiple Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2014-8690.body: A vulnerability was reported in Exponent CMS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Exponent software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The PATH_INFO value, the src parameter of 'index.php', and the First Name/Last Name field for users and edit users are affected.The original advisory is available at:http://exponentcms.lighthouseapp.com/projects/61783/tickets/1230-universal-cross-site-scripting-in-exponent-cms-231-and-priorMayuresh Dani and Narendra Shinde from Qualys reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2014-8690.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Exponent software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2014-8709.title: Android Multiple Flaws Let Users Deny Service, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Gain Elevated Privileges and Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2014-8709.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Android. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
